result.execSummary:
The defendant Roy R Garcia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endangering Safety by use of Dangerous Weapon While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Roy R Garcia in court with attorney Craig Robert Johnson.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. As a continuation from plea hearing, Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Sentencing Proceeded. Statements made by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant sentenced to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day time served.  Huber privileges under Sec.303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply. Court against electronic monitoring. Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year.

Probation Conditions:  
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment. 
-Complete 40 hours of community service. 
-Provide DNA Sample. 
-No weapons for 1 year.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges, to be paid during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 

Filed, 
Letter on behalf of defendant with cover letter from defense counsel, Certificate, Pretrial Incarceration Form, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
from attorney Craig Johnson with attachments.

Defendant Roy R Garcia in court with attorney Craig Robert Johnson.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction WITHHELD until sentencing. Firearm warnings given. Voting admonishment given, DNA notification will be given and the the Sentencing hearing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court reduced cash bail to $100.00, remaining $600.00 to be returned to the remitter.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court. Court ordered cash bail amended.

Defendant Roy R Garcia in court with attorney Craig Robert Johnson.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.   Defense counsel has received offer and needs additional discovery.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM021961  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04/25/2015
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain. Oral No Weapons Order  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 05-07-2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Roy R Garcia
Current: 4920 North Port Washington Road, Glendale, WI 53217   (Effective: 04-28-2015)
Prior: 4920 North Port Washington Road, Glendale, WI 53217

Defendant Roy R Garcia in court.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 24.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/28/15 @ 1:30 pm
